Decoding¶

Decoding Methods¶

Exposes API for decoding based methods

quanta_SL.decode.methods.hybrid_decoding(queries, code_LUT, func: Callable, bch_tuple: quanta_SL.encode.metaclass.BCH, bch_message_bits: int, overlap_bits: int = 1, pack: bool = False, unpack: bool = False, **func_kwargs)¶

Decoding Hybrid (BCH + Stripe) patterns

Parameters

  • queries – (N, n) sized binary matrix

  • code_LUT – Not used, kept for consistency across funcs.

  • func – Minimum Distance implementation

  • bch_message_bits – BCH message dims

  • overlap_bits – Bits that BCH and Stripe encode

  • pack – Pack bits into bytes for memory efficiency

  • unpack – Unpack bytes into bits if a certain algorithm needs.

  • func_kwargs – Additional kwargs to MLE

Returns

Decoded indices.

quanta_SL.decode.methods.minimum_distance_decoding(queries, code_LUT, func: Callable, pack: bool = False, unpack: bool = False, **func_kwargs)¶

Decoding via MLE

Parameters

  • queries – (N, n) sized binary matrix

  • code_LUT – Not used, kept for consistency across funcs.

  • func – Minimum Distance implementation

  • inverse_permuation – Mapping from message int to binary Useful when evaluating strategies with MSE / MAE (where locality matters).

  • pack – Pack bits into bytes for memory efficiency

  • unpack – Unpack bytes into bits if a certain algorithm needs.

  • func_kwargs – Additional kwargs to MLE

Returns

Decoded indices.

quanta_SL.decode.methods.phase_decoding(queries, code_LUT, stripe_width: int = 8, inverse_permuation: Optional[nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]] = None, pack: bool = False, unpack: bool = False)¶

Phase shift based decoding. For stripe scan.

Parameters

  • queries – (N, n) sized binary matrix

  • code_LUT – Not used, kept for consistency across funcs.

  • stripe_width – width of 1’s / 0’s Periodicity is 2 * stripe_width

  • inverse_permuation – Mapping from message int to binary Useful when evaluating strategies with MSE / MAE (where locality matters).

  • pack – Pack bits into bytes for memory efficiency

  • unpack – Unpack bytes into bits if a certain algorithm needs.

Returns

Decoded indices.

Returns

quanta_SL.decode.methods.read_off_decoding(queries, code_LUT, inverse_permuation: Optional[nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]] = None, pack: bool = False, unpack: bool = False)¶

Decoding by simply reading off binary values. No coding scheme used.

Parameters

  • queries – (N, n) sized binary matrix

  • code_LUT – Not used, kept for consistency across funcs.

  • inverse_permuation – Mapping from message int to binary Useful when evaluating strategies with MSE / MAE (where locality matters).

  • pack – Pack bits into bytes for memory efficiency

  • unpack – Unpack bytes into bits if a certain algorithm needs.

Returns

Decoded indices.

quanta_SL.decode.methods.repetition_decoding(queries, code_LUT, num_repeat: int, inverse_permuation: Optional[nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]] = None, pack: bool = False, unpack: bool = False)¶

Decoding a repetition code-word

Parameters

  • queries – (N, n) sized binary matrix

  • code_LUT – Not used, kept for consistency across funcs.

  • num_repeat – repetitions per bit

  • inverse_permuation – Mapping from message int to binary Useful when evaluating strategies with MSE / MAE (where locality matters).

  • pack – Pack bits into bytes for memory efficiency

  • unpack – Unpack bytes into bits if a certain algorithm needs.

Returns

Decoded indices.

quanta_SL.decode.methods.square_wave_phase_unwrap(phase: nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Float], stripe_width: int = 8) → nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Float]¶

Phase unwrap function for square wave :param phase: In radians :param stripe_width: width of 1’s / 0’s

Periodicity is 2 * stripe_width :return:

Minimum Distance Decoding¶

Maximum Likelihood Decoding

(Minimum Distance Decoding methods).

quanta_SL.decode.minimum_distance.factory.brute_minimum_distance(x, y, hamming_dist_LUT: Optional[nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]] = None, xp: module = <module 'numpy' from '/Users/varun/miniconda3/envs/torch39/lib/python3.9/site-packages/numpy/__init__.py'>)¶

Brute force minimum distance between binary vectors

Parameters

  • x – Shape N_x, n

  • y – Shape N_y, n

  • hamming_dist_LUT – precomputed hamming distance values. Useful if x or y are packed as uint8 or uint16.

Returns

Minimum distance indices of size N_x (with values in 0,…,N_y - 1)

quanta_SL.decode.minimum_distance.factory.cupy_minimum_distance(x, y, hamming_dist_LUT: Optional[nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]] = None)¶

Brute force minimum distance between binary vectors. Via CuPy.

Parameters

  • x – Shape N_x, n

  • y – Shape N_y, n

  • hamming_dist_LUT – precomputed hamming distance values. Useful if x or y are packed as uint8 or uint16.

Returns

Minimum distance indices of size N_x (with values in 0,…,N_y - 1)

quanta_SL.decode.minimum_distance.factory.faiss_minimum_distance(x, y, index: Optional[faiss.swigfaiss_avx2.IndexBinaryFlat] = None)¶

Minimum distance using FAISS See https://pynndescent.readthedocs.io.

Parameters

  • x – Shape N_x, n

  • y – Shape N_y, n

  • index – Search index object

Returns

Minimum distance indices of size N_x (with values in 0,…,N_y - 1)

Keops KNN with hamming distance

Parameters

  • x – Shape N_x, n

  • y – Shape N_y, n

  • hamming_dist_LUT – precomputed hamming distance values. Useful if x or y are packed as uint8 or uint16.

Returns

Minimum distance indices of size N_x (with values in 0,…,N_y - 1)

quanta_SL.decode.minimum_distance.factory.numba_minimum_distance(x, y, hamming_dist_LUT: nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int])¶

Minimum distance between binary vectors. Computed brute-force in a loop.

param x

Shape N_x, n

param y

Shape N_y, n

param hamming_dist_LUT

precomputed hamming distance values. Useful if x or y are packed as uint8 or uint16.

return

Minimum distance indices of size N_x (with values in 0,…,N_y - 1)

  • y – Shape N_y, n

quanta_SL.decode.minimum_distance.factory.sklearn_minimum_distance(x, y, index: Optional[sklearn.neighbors._ball_tree.BallTree] = None)¶

Parameters

  • x – Shape N_x, n

  • y – Shape N_y, n

  • index – BallTree instance (or compatible APIs, such as KDTree)

Returns
